metadata.title: CVE-2015-3416 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The sqlite3VXPrintf function in printf.c in SQLite before 3.8.9 does notproperly handle precision and width values during floating-pointconversions, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (integer overflow and stack-based buffer overflow) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via large integers in a crafted printf functioncall in a SELECT statement.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3416` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.8.10.2-1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.8.10.2-1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.8.10.2-1
sqlite3 - 3.8.10.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
sqlite3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.10.2-1').
